education.title: Mortgage Education Center
education.description: Learn about mortgage concepts and how different factors affect your loan.

tooltips.principal: The original amount of money borrowed in a loan, excluding interest and other fees.
tooltips.interestRate: The cost of borrowing money, expressed as a percentage of the loan amount. It determines how much extra you pay beyond the principal.
tooltips.loanTerm: The length of time over which you agree to repay your mortgage, typically expressed in years. Common mortgage terms are 15, 20, or 30 years.
tooltips.repaymentModel: Different methods of structuring loan payments over time. Equal installments keep your payment the same throughout the loan, while decreasing installments start higher but decrease over time.
tooltips.loanStartDate: The date when your mortgage begins and interest starts accruing. This determines your payment schedule.
tooltips.overpayment: Additional payments made beyond the required monthly payment, applied directly to the principal balance. This reduces the total interest paid and can shorten the loan term.
tooltips.originationFee: A fee charged by lenders to process a new loan application, typically 0.5% to 1% of the loan amount.
tooltips.loanInsurance: Insurance that protects the lender if the borrower defaults. For mortgages, this is often called Private Mortgage Insurance (PMI).
tooltips.administrativeFees: Various fees charged by the lender for managing your loan, such as annual service fees or statement fees.
